author: travelandtourworld.com
title: airBaltic Improves Service in Winter seasonTravelandtourworld.com
text:
airBaltic Improves Service in Winter season
The Latvian airline airBaltic enters the winter season with an improved schedule of flights linking the Baltic region with Europe, the Middle East, and the CIS.
For the winter season, airBaltic is introducing new winter holiday destinations of Verona (Italy) and Salzburg (Austria) to its route map. These complement airBaltic’s existing destinations in the Alps, the High Tatras and the Caucasus.
airBaltic has also more than doubled the number of seats on Riga – Berlin route, at the same time shortening the travel time, and lowering the lead-in ticket prices to EUR 39. airBaltic has also significantly improved its link between Stockholm and the Baltic capitals by offering up to five times fare, including taxes, fees and service charges, subject to availability
Route Flight frequency Start date Price *,
Riga – Stockholm Arlanda Up to 5 flights daily October 25,
Riga – Berlin 2 flights daily October 25,
Riga – Verona 1 flight weekly December 26,
Riga – Salzburg 1 flight weekly December 26,
airBaltic serves over 60 destinations from its home base in Riga, Latvia. From every one of these locations, airBaltic offers convenient connections via Riga to its network spanning Europe, Scandinavia, CIS and the Middle East. In addition, airBaltic also offers new direct flights from Tallinn and Vilnius.
